member.summary: A class that is used to create custom boss health bars for modded and vanilla NPCs.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBossBar.GetIconTexture(System.Nullable{Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle}@)
member.summary: Allows you to specify the icon texture, and optionally the frame it should be displayed on. The frame defaults to the entire texture otherwise.
member.param: The frame the texture should be displayed on
member.returns: The icon texture

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBossBar.ModifyInfo(Terraria.GameContent.UI.BigProgressBar.BigProgressBarInfo@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary:
Allows you to handle the logic for when and how this ModBossBar should work. You want to override this if you have a multisegment NPC. Returns null by default. Failing to return false otherwise will lead to your bar being displayed at wrong times.
Return null to let the basic logic run after this hook is called (index validity check and assigning lifePercent to match the health of the NPC) and then allowing it to be drawn.
Return true to allow this ModBossBar to be drawn.
Return false to prevent this ModBossBar from being drawn so that the game will try to pick a different one.
member.param: Contains the index of the NPC the game decided to focus on
The % the bar should be filled with
The % the bar should be filled with (shield)
member.returns: for "single-segment" NPC logic, for allowing drawing, for preventing drawing

member.summary: Allows you to draw things before the default draw code is ran. Return false to prevent drawing the ModBossBar. Returns true by default.
member.param: The spriteBatch that is drawn on
The NPC this ModBossBar is focused on
The draw parameters for the boss bar
member.returns: for allowing drawing, for preventing drawing

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBossBar.PostDraw(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,Terraria.NPC,Terraria.DataStructures.BossBarDrawParams)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things after the bar has been drawn. skipped is true if you or another mod has skipped drawing the bar in PreDraw (possibly hiding it or in favor of new visuals).
member.param: The spriteBatch that is drawn on
The NPC this ModBossBar is focused on
The draw parameters for the boss bar

Return true to block the vanilla re-apply code from being called; returns false by default. The vanilla re-apply code sets the buff time to the "time" argument if that argument is larger than the current buff time.

The vanilla re-apply code sets the buff time to the "time" argument if that argument is larger than the current buff time.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.CommandType.Chat
member.summary: Command can be used in Chat in SP and MP.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.CommandType.Server
member.summary: Command is executed by server in MP.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.CommandType.Console
member.summary: Command can be used in server console during MP.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.CommandType.World
member.summary: Command can be used in Chat in SP and MP, but executes on the Server in MP. (singleplayer ? Chat : Server)

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.CommandCaller.Player
member.summary: The Player object corresponding to the Player that invoked this command. Use this when the Player is needed. Don't use Main.LocalPlayer because that would be incorrect for various CommandTypes.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.CommandCaller.Reply(System.String,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Use this to repond to the Player that invoked this command. This method handles writing to the console, writing to chat, or sending messages over the network for you depending on the CommandType used. Avoid using Main.NewText, Console.WriteLine, or NetMessage.SendChatMessageToClient directly because the logic would change depending on CommandType.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModContent.CleanupModReferences
member.summary: Several arrays and other fields hold references to various classes from mods, we need to clean them up to give properly coded mods a chance to be completely free of references so that they can be collected by the garbage collection. For most things eventually they will be replaced during gameplay, but we want the old instance completely gone quickly.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust
member.summary:
This class represents a type of dust that is added by a mod. Only one instance of this class will ever exist for each type of dust you add.
The Basic Dust Guide teaches the basics of making modded dust.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust.UpdateType
member.summary: Allows you to choose a type of dust for this type of dust to copy the behavior of. Defaults to -1, which means that no behavior is copied.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust.Texture2D
member.summary: The sprite sheet that this type of dust uses. Normally a sprite sheet will consist of a vertical alignment of three 10 x 10 pixel squares, each one containing a possible look for the dust.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust.Type
member.summary: The ID of this type of dust.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust.SetStaticDefaults
member.summary: Allows you to modify the properties after initial loading has completed. This is where you would update ModDust's UpdateType property and modify the Terraria.GameContent.ChildSafety.SafeDust array.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust.OnSpawn(Terraria.Dust)
member.summary: Allows you to modify a dust's fields when it is created.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust.Update(Terraria.Dust)
member.summary: Allows you to customize how you want this type of dust to behave. Return true to allow for vanilla dust updating to also take place; will return true by default. Normally you will want this to return false.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust.MidUpdate(Terraria.Dust)
member.summary: Allows you to add behavior to this dust on top of the default dust behavior. Return true if you're applying your own behavior; return false to make the dust slow down by itself. Normally you will want this to return true.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModDust.GetAlpha(Terraria.Dust,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Allows you to override the color this dust will draw in. Return null to draw it in the normal light color; returns null by default. Note that the dust.noLight field makes the dust ignore lighting and draw in full brightness, and can be set in OnSpawn instead of having to return Color.White here.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModGore
member.summary: This class allows you to customize the behavior of a custom gore.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModGore.UpdateType
member.summary: Allows you to copy the Update behavior of a different type of gore. This defaults to 0, which means no behavior is copied.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModGore.OnSpawn(Terraria.Gore,Terraria.DataStructures.IEntitySource)
member.summary: Allows you to modify a gore's fields when it is created.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModGore.Update(Terraria.Gore)
member.summary: Allows you to customize how you want this type of gore to behave. Return true to allow for vanilla gore updating to also take place; returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModGore.GetAlpha(Terraria.Gore,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Allows you to override the color this gore will draw in. Return null to draw it in the normal light color; returns null by default.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem
member.summary:
This class serves as a place for you to place all your properties and hooks for each item. Create instances of ModItem (preferably overriding this class) to pass as parameters to Mod.AddItem.
The Basic Item Guide teaches the basics of making a modded item.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.Item
member.summary: The item object that this ModItem controls.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.Type
member.summary: Shorthand for Item.type;

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.DisplayName
member.summary: The translations for the display name of this item.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.Tooltip
member.summary: The translations for the tooltip of this item.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.Texture
member.summary: The file name of this type's texture file in the mod loader's file space.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.SacrificeTotal
member.summary: Easy get/set for an item's Sacrifice Total Count

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.SetDefaults
member.summary: This is where you set all your item's properties, such as width, damage, shootSpeed, defense, etc. For those that are familiar with tAPI, this has the same function as .json files.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.OnSpawn(Terraria.DataStructures.IEntitySource)
member.summary: Gets called when your item spawns in world

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.AutoDefaults
member.summary: Automatically sets certain defaults. Override this if you do not want the properties to be set for you.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.AutoStaticDefaults
member.summary: Automatically sets certain static defaults. Override this if you do not want the properties to be set for you.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.ChoosePrefix(Terraria.Utilities.UnifiedRandom)
member.summary: Allows you to manually choose what prefix an item will get.
member.returns: The ID of the prefix to give the item, -1 to use default vanilla behavior

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.MeleePrefix
member.summary: Allows you to change whether or not a weapon receives melee prefixes. Return true if the item should receive melee prefixes and false if it should not. Takes priority over WeaponPrefix, RangedPrefix, and MagicPrefix

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.WeaponPrefix
member.summary: Allows you to change whether or not a weapon only receives generic prefixes. Return true if the item should only receive generic prefixes and false if it should not. Takes priority over RangedPrefix and MagicPrefix Ignored if MeleePrefix returns true

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.RangedPrefix
member.summary: Allows you to change whether or not a weapon receives ranged prefixes. Return true if the item should receive ranged prefixes and false if it should not. Takes priority over MagicPrefix

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.MagicPrefix
member.summary: Allows you to change whether or not a weapon receives magic prefixes. Return true if the item should receive magic prefixes and false if it should not.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.PrefixChance(System.Int32,Terraria.Utilities.UnifiedRandom)
member.summary:
To prevent putting the item in the tinkerer slot, return false when pre is -3. To prevent rolling of a prefix on spawn, return false when pre is -1. To force rolling of a prefix on spawn, return true when pre is -1.
To reduce the probability of a prefix on spawn (pre == -1) to X%, return false 100-4X % of the time. To increase the probability of a prefix on spawn (pre == -1) to X%, return true (4X-100)/3 % of the time.
To delete a prefix from an item when the item is loaded, return false when pre is the prefix you want to delete. Use AllowPrefix to prevent rolling of a certain prefix.
member.param: The prefix being applied to the item, or the roll mode. -1 is when the item is naturally generated in a chest, crafted, purchased from an NPC, looted from a grab bag (excluding presents), or dropped by a slain enemy (if it's spawned with prefixGiven: -1). -2 is when the item is rolled in the tinkerer. -3 determines if the item can be placed in the tinkerer slot.
The random number generator class to be used in random choices

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.AllowPrefix(System.Int32)
member.summary: Force a re-roll of a prefix by returning false.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.CanUseItem(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Returns whether or not this item can be used. By default returns true.
member.param: The player using the item.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.CanAutoReuseItem(Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Allows you to modify the autoswing (auto-reuse) behavior of this item without having to mess with Item.autoReuse.
Useful to create effects like the Feral Claws which makes melee weapons and whips auto-reusable.
Return true to enable autoswing (if not already enabled through autoReuse), return false to prevent autoswing. Returns null by default, which applies vanilla behavior.
member.param: The player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.UseStyle(Terraria.Player,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the location and rotation of this item in its use animation.
member.param: The player.
The source rectangle for the held item's texture.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.HoldStyle(Terraria.Player,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the location and rotation of this item when the player is holding it.
member.param: The player.
The source rectangle for the held item's texture.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.HoldItem(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when the player is holding this item (for example, torches make light and water candles increase spawn rate).
member.param: The player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.UseTimeMultiplier(Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Allows you to change the effective useTime of an item.
Note that this hook may cause items' actions to run less or more times than they should per a single use.
member.returns: The multiplier on the usage time. 1f by default. Values greater than 1 increase the item use's length.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.UseAnimationMultiplier(Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Allows you to change the effective useAnimation of an item.
Note that this hook may cause items' actions to run less or more times than they should per a single use.
member.returns: The multiplier on the animation time. 1f by default. Values greater than 1 increase the item animation's length.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.UseSpeedMultiplier(Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Allows you to safely change both useTime and useAnimation while keeping the values relative to each other.
Useful for status effects.
member.returns: The multiplier on the use speed. 1f by default. Values greater than 1 increase the overall item speed.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.GetHealLife(Terraria.Player,System.Boolean,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify the amount of life a life healing item will heal for, based on player buffs, accessories, etc. This is only called for items with a healLife value.
member.param: The player using the item.
Whether the item is being used through quick heal or not.
The amount of life being healed.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.GetHealMana(Terraria.Player,System.Boolean,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify the amount of mana a mana healing item will heal for, based on player buffs, accessories, etc. This is only called for items with a healMana value.
member.param: The player using the item.
Whether the item is being used through quick heal or not.
The amount of mana being healed.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.ModifyManaCost(Terraria.Player,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify the amount of mana this item will consume on use, based on player buffs, accessories, etc. This is only called for items with a mana value.
member.param: The player using the item.
Used for decreasingly stacking buffs (most common). Only ever use -= on this field.
Use to directly multiply the item's effective mana cost. Good for debuffs, or things which should stack separately (eg meteor armor set bonus).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.OnMissingMana(Terraria.Player,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to make stuff happen when a player doesn't have enough mana for the item they are trying to use. If the player has high enough mana after this hook runs, mana consumption will happen normally. Only runs once per item use.
member.param: The player using the item.
The mana needed to use the item.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.OnConsumeMana(Terraria.Player,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to make stuff happen when a player consumes mana on use of this item.
member.param: The player using the item.
The mana consumed from the player.

member.summary: Allows you to set an item's sorting group in Journey Mode's duplication menu. This is useful for setting custom item types that group well together, or whenever the default vanilla sorting doesn't sort the way you want it.

member.param: The Player that owns the bait

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.CanResearch

member.summary: Allows you to create custom behaviour when an item is accepted by the Research function

member.summary: Allows you to dynamically modify a weapon's crit chance based on player and item conditions. Can be utilized to modify damage beyond the tools that DamageClass has to offer.

The total crit chance of the item after all normal crit chance calculations.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.NeedsAmmo(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Whether or not having no ammo prevents an item that uses ammo from shooting. Return false to allow shooting with no ammo in the inventory, in which case this item will act as if the default ammo for it is being used. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.PickAmmo(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,System.Int32@,System.Single@,Terraria.ModLoader.StatModifier@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify various properties of the projectile created by a weapon based on the ammo it is using. This hook is called on the ammo.
member.param: The item that is using this ammo.
The player using the item.
The ID of the fired projectile.
The speed of the fired projectile.

The damage modifier for the projectile.
Total weapon damage is included as Flat damage.
Be careful not to apply flat or base damage bonuses which are already applied to the weapon.
The knockback of the fired projectile.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.CanChooseAmmo(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Whether or not the given ammo item is valid for this weapon. If this, or on the ammo, returns false, then the ammo will not be valid for this weapon.
By default, returns null and allows and to decide. Return true to make the ammo valid regardless of these fields, and return false to make it invalid.
If false is returned, the , , , and hooks are never called.
member.param: The ammo that the weapon is attempting to select.
The player which this weapon and the potential ammo belong to.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.CanBeChosenAsAmmo(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Whether or not this ammo item is valid for the given weapon. If this, or on the weapon, returns false, then the ammo will not be valid for this weapon.
By default, returns null and allows and to decide. Return true to make the ammo valid regardless of these fields, and return false to make it invalid.
If false is returned, the , , , and hooks are never called.
member.param: The weapon attempting to select the ammo.
The player which the weapon and this potential ammo belong to.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.CanConsumeAmmo(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Whether or not the given ammo item will be consumed by this weapon.
By default, returns true; return false to prevent ammo consumption.
If false is returned, the and hooks are never called.
member.param: The ammo that the weapon is attempting to consume.
The player which this weapon and the ammo belong to.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.CanBeConsumedAsAmmo(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Whether or not this ammo item will be consumed by the given weapon.
By default, returns true; return false to prevent ammo consumption.
If false is returned, the and hooks are never called.
member.param: The weapon attempting to consume the ammo.
The player which the weapon and this ammo belong to.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.OnConsumeAmmo(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Allows you to make things happen when the given ammo is consumed by this weapon.
Called before the ammo stack is reduced, and is never called if the ammo isn't consumed in the first place.
member.param: The ammo that this weapon is currently using.
The player which this weapon and the ammo belong to.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.OnConsumedAsAmmo(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Allows you to make things happen when this ammo is consumed by the given weapon.
Called before the ammo stack is reduced, and is never called if the ammo isn't consumed in the first place.
member.param: The weapon that is currently using this ammo.
The player which the weapon and this ammo belong to.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.CanCatchNPC(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Allows you to determine whether this item can catch the given NPC.
Return true or false to say the given NPC can or cannot be caught, respectively, regardless of vanilla rules.
Returns null by default, which allows vanilla's NPC catching rules to decide the target's fate.
If this returns false, is never called.
NOTE: this does not classify the given item as an NPC-catching tool, which is necessary for catching NPCs in the first place.
To do that, you will need to use the "CatchingTool" set in ItemID.Sets.
member.param: The NPC the player is trying to catch.
The player attempting to catch the NPC.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.OnCatchNPC(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.Player,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when this item attempts to catch the given NPC.
member.param: The NPC which the player attempted to catch.
The player attempting to catch the given NPC.
Whether or not the given NPC has been successfully caught.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.IsVanitySet(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns whether or not the head armor, body armor, and leg armor textures make up a set. This hook is used for the PreUpdateVanitySet, UpdateVanitySet, and ArmorSetShadows hooks. By default, this will return the same value as the IsArmorSet hook (passing the equipment textures' associated items as parameters), so you will not have to use this hook unless you want vanity effects to be entirely separate from armor sets. Note that this hook is only ever called through this item's associated equipment texture.

The body.
The legs.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.PreUpdateVanitySet(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects (such as the necro armor's hurt noise) when the player wears this item's vanity set. This hook is called regardless of whether the player is frozen in any way. Note that this hook is only ever called through this item's associated equipment texture.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.UpdateVanitySet(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects (such as dust) when the player wears this item's vanity set. This hook will only be called if the player is not frozen in any way. Note that this hook is only ever called through this item's associated equipment texture.
member.param: The player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.ArmorSetShadows(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to determine special visual effects this vanity set has on the player without having to code them yourself. Note that this hook is only ever called through this item's associated equipment texture. Use the player.armorEffectDraw bools to activate the desired effects.
member.param: The player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem.SetMatch(System.Boolean,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the equipment that the player appears to be wearing. This hook will only be called for body armor and leg armor. Note that equipSlot is not the same as the item type of the armor the player will appear to be wearing. Worn equipment has a separate set of IDs. You can find the vanilla equipment IDs by looking at the headSlot, bodySlot, and legSlot fields for items, and modded equipment IDs by looking at EquipLoader. If this hook is called on body armor, equipSlot allows you to modify the leg armor the player appears to be wearing. If you modify it, make sure to set robes to true. If this hook is called on leg armor, equipSlot allows you to modify the leg armor the player appears to be wearing, and the robes parameter is useless. Note that this hook is only ever called through this item's associated equipment texture.
member.param: if set to true [male].
The equip slot.
if set to true [robes].

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMapLayer
member.summary: This class is used to facilitate easily drawing icons and other things over the map. Pylons and spawn/bed icons are examples of vanilla map layers. Use to selectively hide vanilla layers if needed.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMapLayer.Draw(Terraria.Map.MapOverlayDrawContext@,System.String@)
member.summary: This method is called when this MapLayer is to be drawn. Map layers are drawn after the map itself is drawn. Use as described in ExampleMod and in vanilla examples for full compatibility and simplicity of code.
member.param: Contains the scaling and positional data of the map being drawn. You should use the MapOverlayDrawContext.Draw method for all drawing
The mouse hover text. Assign a value typically if the user is hovering over something you draw

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMenu
member.summary: A class that is used to customize aesthetic features of the main menu, such as the logo, background and music.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMenu.Logo
member.summary: The logo texture shown when this ModMenu is active. If not overridden, it will use the tModLoader logo.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMenu.SunTexture
member.summary: The sun texture shown when this ModMenu is active. If not overridden, it will use the vanilla sun.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMenu.MoonTexture
member.summary: The moon texture shown when this ModMenu is active. If not overridden, it will use the vanilla moon.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMenu.Music
member.summary: The music that will be played while this ModMenu is active. If not overridden, it will use the vanilla music.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMenu.MenuBackgroundStyle
member.summary: The background style that will be used when this ModMenu is active. If not overridden, it will use the vanilla background.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMenu.IsAvailable
member.summary: Controls whether this ModMenu will be available to switch to. Useful if you want this menu to only be available at specific times.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMenu.DisplayName
member.summary: Controls the name that shows up at the base of the screen when this ModMenu is active. If not overridden, it will use this mod's display name.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMenu.OnSelected
member.summary: Called when this ModMenu is selected. Set the state of the UserInterface to a given UIState to make that UIState appear on the main menu.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMenu.OnDeselected
member.summary: Called when this ModMenu is deselected.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMenu.Update(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called when this ModMenu's logic is updated.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMenu.PreDrawLogo(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@,System.Single@,System.Single@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color@)
member.summary: Called just before the logo is drawn, and allows you to modify some of the parameters of the logo draw code.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMenu.PostDrawLogo(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,System.Single,System.Single,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Called just after the logo is drawn, and gives the values of some of the parameters of the logo draw code.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMount
member.summary: This class serves as a place for you to place all your properties and hooks for each mount. Create instances of ModMoundData (preferably overriding this class) to pass as parameters to Mod.AddMount. Only one instance of ModMount will exist for each mount, so storing player specific data on the ModMount is not good. Modders can use player.mount._mountSpecificData or a ModPlayer class to store player specific data relating to a mount. Use SetMount to assign these fields.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMount.MountData
member.summary: The vanilla MountData object that is controlled by this ModMount.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMount.Type
member.summary: The index of this ModMount in the Mount.mounts array.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMount.Texture
member.summary: The file name of this type's texture file in the mod loader's file space.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMount.SetStaticDefaults
member.summary: Allows you to modify the properties after initial loading has completed. This is where you would set properties of this type of mount.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMount.JumpHeight(Terraria.Player,System.Int32@,System.Single)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the mount's jump height based on its state.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMount.JumpSpeed(Terraria.Player,System.Single@,System.Single)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the mount's jump speed based on its state.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMount.UpdateEffects(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when mount is used (creating dust etc.) Can also be used for mount special abilities.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMount.UpdateFrame(Terraria.Player,System.Int32,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2)
member.summary: Allows for manual updating of mount frame. Return false to stop the default frame behavior. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMount.UseAbility(Terraria.Player,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen while the mouse is pressed while the mount is active. Called each tick the mouse is pressed.
member.param: Does nothing yet

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMount.AimAbility(Terraria.Player,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when the mount ability is aiming (while charging).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMount.SetMount(Terraria.Player,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when this mount is spawned in. Useful for player-specific initialization, utilizing player.mount._mountSpecificData or a ModPlayer class since ModMount is shared between all players. Custom dust spawning logic is also possible via the skipDust parameter.
member.param: Set to true to skip the vanilla dust spawning logic

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModMount.Dismount(Terraria.Player,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when this mount is de-spawned. Useful for player-specific cleanup, see SetMount. Custom dust spawning logic is also possible via the skipDust parameter.
member.param: Set to true to skip the vanilla dust spawning logic

member.summary: Allows for complete customization of mount drawing. This method will be called once for each supported mount texture layer that exists. Use drawType to conditionally apply changes. drawType corresponds to the following: 0: backTexture, 1: backTextureExtra, 2: frontTexture. 3: frontTextureExtra Corresponding glow textures, such as backTextureGlow, are paired with their corresponding texture and passed into this method as well. Return false if you are manually adding DrawData to playerDrawData to replace the vanilla draw behavior, otherwise tweak ref variables to customize the drawing and add additional DrawData to playerDrawData.
member.param: Corresponds to the following: 0: backTexture, 1: backTextureExtra, 2: frontTexture. 3: frontTextureExtra
The corresponding glow texture, if present

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNet.IncompatiblePatchVersion
member.summary: Update every time a change is pushed to stable which is incompatible between server and clients. Ignored if not updated each month.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC
member.summary: This class serves as a place for you to place all your properties and hooks for each NPC. Create instances of ModNPC (preferably overriding this class) to pass as parameters to Mod.AddNPC.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.NPC
member.summary: The NPC object that this ModNPC controls.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.Type
member.summary: Shorthand for NPC.type;

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.DisplayName
member.summary: The translations for the display name of this NPC.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.Texture
member.summary: The file name of this type's texture file in the mod loader's file space.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.HeadTexture
member.summary: The file name of this NPC's head texture file, to be used in autoloading.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.BossHeadTexture
member.summary: This file name of this NPC's boss head texture file, to be used in autoloading.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.AIType
member.summary: Determines which type of vanilla NPC this ModNPC will copy the behavior (AI) of. Leave as 0 to not copy any behavior. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.AnimationType
member.summary: Determines which type of vanilla NPC this ModNPC will copy the animation/framing logic of, which includes checks to sets such as and , and others. For example, selecting the Guide's type will copy how many frames, extra frames, and attack frames the Guide has, and use those value for animation of this NPC. This is entirely based off of type and not the ModNPC instance itself; so be cautious if you change this NPC's type.

members.member: The ID of the music that plays when this NPC is on or near the screen. Defaults to -1, which means music plays normally. Will be superceded by ModSceneEffect. Kept for legacy.
The priority of the music that plays when this NPC is on or near the screen. Will be superceded by ModSceneEffect. Kept for legacy.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.DrawOffsetY
member.summary: The vertical offset used for drawing this NPC. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.Banner
member.summary: The type of NPC that this NPC will be considered as when determining banner drops and banner bonuses. By default this will be 0, which means this NPC is not associated with any banner. To give your NPC its own banner, set this field to the NPC's type.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.BannerItem
member.summary: The type of the item this NPC drops for every 50 times it is defeated. For any ModNPC whose banner field is set to the type of this NPC, that ModNPC will drop this banner.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.SpawnModBiomes
member.summary: The ModBiome Types associated with this NPC spawning, if applicable. Used in Bestiary

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.TownNPCStayingHomeless
member.summary: Setting this to true will make the NPC not appear in the housing menu nor make it find an house.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.SetDefaults
member.summary: Allows you to set all your NPC's properties, such as width, damage, aiStyle, lifeMax, etc.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.OnSpawn(Terraria.DataStructures.IEntitySource)
member.summary: Gets called when your NPC spawns in world

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.AutoStaticDefaults
member.summary: Automatically sets certain static defaults. Override this if you do not want the properties to be set for you.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.ScaleExpertStats(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Allows you to customize this NPC's stats in expert mode. This is useful because expert mode's doubling of damage and life might be too much sometimes (for example, with bosses). Also useful for scaling life with the number of players in the world.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.SetBestiary(Terraria.GameContent.Bestiary.BestiaryDatabase,Terraria.GameContent.Bestiary.BestiaryEntry)
member.summary: Allows you to set an NPC's information in the Bestiary.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.ModifyTypeName(System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the type name of this NPC dynamically.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.ModifyHoverBoundingBox(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the bounding box for hovering over this NPC (affects things like whether or not its name is displayed).
member.param: The bounding box used for determining whether or not the NPC counts as being hovered over.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.SetNPCNameList
member.summary:
Allows you to give a list of names this NPC can be given on spawn.
By default, returns a blank list, which means the NPC will simply use its type name as its given name when prompted.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.TownNPCProfile
member.summary:
Allows you to set the town NPC profile that this NPC uses.
By default, returns null, meaning that the NPC doesn't use one.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.ResetEffects
member.summary: This is where you reset any fields you add to your subclass to their default states. This is necessary in order to reset your fields if they are conditionally set by a tick update but the condition is no longer satisfied. (Note: This hook is only really useful for GlobalNPC, but is included in ModNPC for completion.)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.PreAI
member.summary: Allows you to determine how this NPC behaves. Return false to stop the vanilla AI and the AI hook from being run. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.AI
member.summary: Allows you to determine how this NPC behaves. This will only be called if PreAI returns true.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.SendExtraAI(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary:
If you are storing AI information outside of the NPC.ai array, use this to send that AI information between clients and servers, which will be handled in .
Called whenever is successfully sent, for example on NPC creation, on player join, or whenever NPC.netUpdate is set to true in the update loop for that tick.
Only called on the server.
member.param: The writer.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.ReceiveExtraAI(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary:
Use this to receive information that was sent in .
Called whenever is successfully received.
Only called on the client.
member.param: The reader.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.FindFrame(System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the frame from this NPC's texture that is drawn, which is necessary in order to animate NPCs.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.HitEffect(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary:
Allows you to make things happen whenever this NPC is hit, such as creating dust or gores.
This hook is client side. Usually when something happens when an NPC dies such as item spawning, you use NPCLoot, but you can use HitEffect paired with a check for `if (NPC.life <= 0)` to do client-side death effects, such as spawning dust, gore, or death sounds.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.UpdateLifeRegen(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to make the NPC either regenerate health or take damage over time by setting NPC.lifeRegen. Regeneration or damage will occur at a rate of half of NPC.lifeRegen per second. The damage parameter is the number that appears above the NPC's head if it takes damage over time.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CheckActive
member.summary: Whether or not to run the code for checking whether this NPC will remain active. Return false to stop this NPC from being despawned and to stop this NPC from counting towards the limit for how many NPCs can exist near a player. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CheckDead
member.summary: Whether or not this NPC should be killed when it reaches 0 health. You may program extra effects in this hook (for example, how Golem's head lifts up for the second phase of its fight). Return false to stop this NPC from being killed. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.SpecialOnKill
member.summary: Allows you to call OnKill on your own when the NPC dies, rather then letting vanilla call it on its own. Returns false by default.
member.returns: Return true to stop vanilla from calling OnKill on its own. Do this if you call OnKill yourself.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.PreKill
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether or not this NPC will do anything upon death (besides dying). Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.OnKill
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when this NPC dies (for example, dropping items and setting ModSystem fields). This hook runs on the server/single player. For client-side effects, such as dust, gore, and sounds, see HitEffect

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CanFallThroughPlatforms
member.summary:
Allows you to determine how and when this NPC can fall through platforms and similar tiles.
Return true to allow this NPC to fall through platforms, false to prevent it. Returns null by default, applying vanilla behaviors (based on aiStyle and type).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CanBeCaughtBy(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Allows you to determine whether the given item can catch this NPC.
Return true or false to say this NPC can or cannot be caught, respectively, regardless of vanilla rules.
Returns null by default, which allows vanilla's NPC catching rules to decide the target's fate.
If this returns false, is never called.
NOTE: this does not classify the given item as an NPC-catching tool, which is necessary for catching NPCs in the first place.
To do that, you will need to use the "CatchingTool" set in ItemID.Sets.
member.param: The item with which the player is trying to catch this NPC.
The player attempting to catch this NPC.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.OnCaughtBy(Terraria.Player,Terraria.Item,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when the given item attempts to catch this NPC.
member.param: The player attempting to catch this NPC.
The item used to catch this NPC.
Whether or not this NPC has been successfully caught.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.ModifyNPCLoot(Terraria.ModLoader.NPCLoot)
member.summary:
Allows you to add and modify NPC loot tables to drop on death and to appear in the Bestiary.
The Basic NPC Drops and Loot 1.4 Guide explains how to use this hook to modify NPC loot.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.BossLoot(System.String@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to customize what happens when this boss dies, such as which name is displayed in the defeat message and what type of potion it drops.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CanHitPlayer(Terraria.Player,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether this NPC can hit the given player. Return false to block this NPC from hitting the target. Returns true by default. CooldownSlot determines which of the player's cooldown counters to use (-1, 0, or 1), and defaults to -1.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.ModifyHitPlayer(Terraria.Player,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, etc., that this NPC does to a player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.OnHitPlayer(Terraria.Player,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when this NPC hits a player (for example, inflicting debuffs).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CanHitNPC(Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether this NPC can hit the given friendly NPC. Return true to allow hitting the target, return false to block this NPC from hitting the target, and return null to use the vanilla code for whether the target can be hit. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.ModifyHitNPC(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@,System.Single@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, knockback, etc., that this NPC does to a friendly NPC.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.OnHitNPC(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when this NPC hits a friendly NPC.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CanBeHitByItem(Terraria.Player,Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether this NPC can be hit by the given melee weapon when swung. Return true to allow hitting the NPC, return false to block hitting the NPC, and return null to use the vanilla code for whether the NPC can be hit. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.ModifyHitByItem(Terraria.Player,Terraria.Item,System.Int32@,System.Single@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, knockback, etc., that this NPC takes from a melee weapon.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.OnHitByItem(Terraria.Player,Terraria.Item,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when this NPC is hit by a melee weapon.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CanBeHitByProjectile(Terraria.Projectile)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether this NPC can be hit by the given projectile. Return true to allow hitting the NPC, return false to block hitting the NPC, and return null to use the vanilla code for whether the NPC can be hit. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.ModifyHitByProjectile(Terraria.Projectile,System.Int32@,System.Single@,System.Boolean@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, knockback, etc., that this NPC takes from a projectile. This method is only called for the owner of the projectile, meaning that in multi-player, projectiles owned by a player call this method on that client, and projectiles owned by the server such as enemy projectiles call this method on the server.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.OnHitByProjectile(Terraria.Projectile,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when this NPC is hit by a projectile.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.StrikeNPC(System.Double@,System.Int32,System.Single@,System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to use a custom damage formula for when this NPC takes damage from any source. For example, you can change the way defense works or use a different crit multiplier. Return false to stop the game from running the vanilla damage formula; returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.BossHeadSlot(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to customize the boss head texture used by an NPC based on its state. Set index to -1 to stop the texture from being displayed.
member.param: The index for NPCID.Sets.BossHeadTextures

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.BossHeadRotation(System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to customize the rotation of this NPC's boss head icon on the map.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.BossHeadSpriteEffects(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteEffects@)
member.summary: Allows you to flip this NPC's boss head icon on the map.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.GetAlpha(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the color and transparency in which this NPC is drawn. Return null to use the default color (normally light and buff color). Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.DrawEffects(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color@)
member.summary: Allows you to add special visual effects to this NPC (such as creating dust), and modify the color in which the NPC is drawn.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.PreDraw(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things behind this NPC, or to modify the way this NPC is drawn. Substract screenPos from the draw position before drawing. Return false to stop the game from drawing the NPC (useful if you're manually drawing the NPC). Returns true by default.
member.param: The spritebatch to draw on
The screen position used to translate world position into screen position
The color the NPC is drawn in

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.PostDraw(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things in front of this NPC. Substract screenPos from the draw position before drawing. This method is called even if PreDraw returns false.
member.param: The spritebatch to draw on
The screen position used to translate world position into screen position
The color the NPC is drawn in

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.DrawBehind(System.Int32)
member.summary: When used in conjunction with "NPC.hide = true", allows you to specify that this NPC should be drawn behind certain elements. Add the index to one of Main.DrawCacheNPCsMoonMoon, DrawCacheNPCsOverPlayers, DrawCacheNPCProjectiles, or DrawCacheNPCsBehindNonSolidTiles.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.DrawHealthBar(System.Byte,System.Single@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@)
member.summary: Allows you to control how the health bar for this NPC is drawn. The hbPosition parameter is the same as Main.hbPosition; it determines whether the health bar gets drawn above or below the NPC by default. The scale parameter is the health bar's size. By default, it will be the normal 1f; most bosses set this to 1.5f. Return null to let the normal vanilla health-bar-drawing code to run. Return false to stop the health bar from being drawn. Return true to draw the health bar in the position specified by the position parameter (note that this is the world position, not screen position).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.SpawnChance(Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo)
member.summary: Whether or not this NPC can spawn with the given spawning conditions. Return the weight for the chance of this NPC to spawn compared to vanilla mobs. All vanilla mobs combined have a total weight of 1. Returns 0 by default, which disables natural spawning. Remember to always use spawnInfo.player and not Main.LocalPlayer when checking Player or ModPlayer fields, otherwise your mod won't work in Multiplayer.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.SpawnNPC(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to customize how this NPC is created when it naturally spawns (for example, its position or ai array). Return the return value of NPC.NewNPC. By default this method spawns this NPC on top of the tile at the given coordinates.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CanTownNPCSpawn(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Whether or not the conditions have been met for this town NPC to be able to move into town. For example, the Demolitionist requires that any player has an explosive.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CheckConditions(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to define special conditions required for this town NPC's house. For example, Truffle requires the house to be in an aboveground mushroom biome.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.UsesPartyHat
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether this town NPC wears a party hat during a party. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CanChat
member.summary:
Allows you to determine whether this NPC can talk with the player. By default, returns if the NPC is a town NPC.
This hook is not based on the type of the NPC, and is queried specifically on the ModNPC itself, regardless of if, for example, the type of the NPC instance is changed. Returning true in all circumstances will *always* make the NPC able to be chatted with no matter what else you do the NPC instance itself.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.GetChat
member.summary: Allows you to give this NPC a chat message when a player talks to it. By default returns something embarrassing.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.SetChatButtons(System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to set the text for the buttons that appear on this NPC's chat window. A parameter left as an empty string will not be included as a button on the chat window.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.OnChatButtonClicked(System.Boolean,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to make something happen whenever a button is clicked on this NPC's chat window. The firstButton parameter tells whether the first button or second button (button and button2 from SetChatButtons) was clicked. Set the shop parameter to true to open this NPC's shop.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.SetupShop(Terraria.Chest,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to add items to this NPC's shop. Add an item by setting the defaults of shop.item[nextSlot] then incrementing nextSlot. In the end, nextSlot must have a value of 1 greater than the highest index in shop.item that contains an item.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.CanGoToStatue(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether this NPC can be telported to a King or Queen statue. Returns false by default.
member.param: Whether the NPC is being teleported to a King or Queen statue.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.OnGoToStatue(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when this NPC teleports to a King or Queen statue. This method is only called server side.
member.param: Whether the NPC was teleported to a King or Queen statue.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.TownNPCAttackStrength(System.Int32@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the damage and knockback of this town NPC's attack before the damage is scaled. (More information on scaling in GlobalNPC.BuffTownNPCs.)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.TownNPCAttackCooldown(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the cooldown between each of this town NPC's attack. The cooldown will be a number greater than or equal to the first parameter, and less then the sum of the two parameters.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.TownNPCAttackProj(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the projectile type of this town NPC's attack, and how long it takes for the projectile to actually appear. This hook is only used when the town NPC has an attack type of 0 (throwing), 1 (shooting), or 2 (magic).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.TownNPCAttackProjSpeed(System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the speed at which this town NPC throws a projectile when it attacks. Multiplier is the speed of the projectile, gravityCorrection is how much extra the projectile gets thrown upwards, and randomOffset allows you to randomize the projectile's velocity in a square centered around the original velocity. This hook is only used when the town NPC has an attack type of 0 (throwing), 1 (shooting), or 2 (magic).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.TownNPCAttackShoot(System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to tell the game that this town NPC has already created a projectile and will still create more projectiles as part of a single attack so that the game can animate the NPC's attack properly. Only used when the town NPC has an attack type of 1 (shooting).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.TownNPCAttackMagic(System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to control the brightness of the light emitted by this town NPC's aura when it performs a magic attack. Only used when the town NPC has an attack type of 2 (magic)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.TownNPCAttackSwing(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the width and height of the item this town NPC swings when it attacks, which controls the range of this NPC's swung weapon. Only used when the town NPC has an attack type of 3 (swinging).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.DrawTownAttackGun(System.Single@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to customize how this town NPC's weapon is drawn when this NPC is shooting (this NPC must have an attack type of 1). Scale is a multiplier for the item's drawing size, item is the ID of the item to be drawn, and closeness is how close the item should be drawn to the NPC.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.DrawTownAttackSwing(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D@,System.Int32@,System.Single@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@)
member.summary: Allows you to customize how this town NPC's weapon is drawn when this NPC is swinging it (this NPC must have an attack type of 3). Item is the Texture2D instance of the item to be drawn (use Main.itemTexture[id of item]), itemSize is the width and height of the item's hitbox (the same values for TownNPCAttackSwing), scale is the multiplier for the item's drawing size, and offset is the offset from which to draw the item from its normal position.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.NeedSaving
member.summary:
Makes this ModNPC save along the world even if it's not a townNPC. Defaults to false.
NOTE: A town NPC will always be saved.
NOTE: A NPC that needs saving will not despawn naturally.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.SaveData(Terraria.ModLoader.IO.TagCompound)
member.summary:
Allows you to save custom data for the given item. Allows you to save custom data for the given npc.
NOTE: The provided tag is always empty by default, and is provided as an argument only for the sake of convenience and optimization.
NOTE: Try to only save data that isn't default values.
NOTE: The npc may be saved even if NeedSaving returns false and this is not a townNPC, if another mod returns true on NeedSaving.
member.param: The TagCompound to save data into. Note that this is always empty by default, and is provided as an argument

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModNPC.LoadData(Terraria.ModLoader.IO.TagCompound)
member.summary: Allows you to load custom data that you have saved for this npc.
member.param: The tag.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPacket
member.summary:
This class inherits from BinaryWriter. This means that you can use all of its writing functions to send information between client and server. This class also comes with a Send method that's used to actually send everything you've written between client and server.
ModPacket has all the same methods as BinaryWriter, and some additional ones.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPacket.Send(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends all the information you've written between client and server. If the toClient parameter is non-negative, this packet will only be sent to the specified client. If the ignoreClient parameter is non-negative, this packet will not be sent to the specified client.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModCactus
member.summary: This class represents a type of modded cactus. This class encapsulates a function for retrieving the cactus's texture and an array for type of soil it grows on.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModCactus.PlantTileId
member.summary: The cactus will share a tile ID with the vanilla cacti (80), so that the cacti can freely convert between each other if the sand below is converted.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTree
member.summary: This class represents a type of modded tree. The tree will share a tile ID with the vanilla trees (5), so that the trees can freely convert between each other if the soil below is converted. This class encapsulates several functions that distinguish each type of tree from each other.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTree.PlantTileId
member.summary: The tree will share a tile ID with the vanilla trees (5), so that the trees can freely convert between each other if the soil below is converted.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTree.CountsAsTreeType
member.summary: Used mostly for vanilla tree shake loot tables

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTree.CreateDust
member.summary: Return the type of dust created when this tree is destroyed. Returns 7 by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTree.TreeLeaf
member.summary: Return the type of gore created when the tree grow, being shook and falling leaves on windy days, returns -1 by default

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTree.Shake(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Executed on tree shake, return false to skip vanilla tree shake drops

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTree.CanDropAcorn
member.summary: Whether or not this tree can drop acorns. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTree.SaplingGrowthType(System.Int32@)
M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTree.DropWood

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTree.GetTopTextures

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModTree.GetBranchTextures
member.summary: Return the texture containing the possible tree branches that can be drawn next to this tree. The framing was determined under SetTreeFoliageSettings

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPalmTree

The palm tree will share a tile ID with the vanilla palm trees (323), so that the trees can freely convert between each other if the sand below is converted. This class encapsulates several functions that distinguish each type of palm tree from each other.

M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModPalmTree.DropWood
